table.name: rate_geo
table.description: Also known as a lane, a rate geo is a prescribed course for ships, aircraft, etc. that can have costing (or time of travel) associated with it.  A rate geo may be something as general as West Coast to East Coast, country to country, state to state, or as specific as zip code to zip code.  GC3 will always look at the most granular rate_geo it can find.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate geo.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_XID
columns.description: The XID for the rate geo.

columns.name: RATE_OFFERING_GID
columns.description: Indicates the rate offering to which this rate reo record is linked.

columns.name: X_LANE_GID
columns.description: Indicates the lane definition (the from and to geo hierarchies) that this rate geo record will cover.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Links the rate geo record to an equipment group profile that, if provided, will constrain the rate to only use equipment groups identified as compatible based on the defined equipment group profile.

columns.name: RATE_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: Links to the rate service record which, based on the related rate service type, determines how to calculate the timing for a shipment.

columns.name: MIN_COST
columns.description: The minimum charge for a shipment. The minimum charge is absolute minimum charge that applies, so the calculated cost of a shipment will be compared to the minimum charge and the cost will always be greater than or equal to the minimum charge.

columns.name: MIN_COST_GID
columns.description: The minimum charge currency code.

columns.name: MIN_COST_BASE
columns.description: The minimum charge in the base currency.

columns.name: TOTAL_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Constraint value for the total number of stops (pickup and delivery) that this rate can be used for.

columns.name: PICKUP_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Constraint value for the number of pickup stops that this rate can be used for.

columns.name: DELIVERY_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Constraint value for the number of delivery stops that this rate can be used for.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_ALLOWANCE_PERCENT
columns.description: The allowed amount of out of route distance (as a percent of the direct source to final destination distance) that is free before circuitous distance cost are charged.  Circuity Allowance Percent = (t/d-1)*100 where: t is the allowed total distance traveled between the first and last stop of the shipment. d is the shortest distance between the first and last stop of the shipment. If the allowed total distance is 1500 miles and the distance between the first and last stop is 1300 miles, Circuity Allowance Percent = (1500/1300-1)*100 = (1.15-1)*100 = 15%. The lower the percentage, the more in line the route must be.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST
columns.description: The per distance unit charge for each unit over the included/free amount.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the circuity distance cost.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST_BASE
columns.description: The circuity distance cost in base units.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_PERCENT
columns.description: The rate constraint that defines the maximum circuity percent for the rate. If this value is exceeded, the rate cannot be applied to the shipment. To use this field, you must have a value in the Circuity Distance Cost field. If there is no additional cost applicable, then enter a cost of 0.00.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE
columns.description: The rate constraint that defines the maximum circuity distance for the rate. If this value is exceeded, the rate cannot be applied to the shipment. To use this field, you must have a value in the Circuity Distance Cost field. If there is no additional cost applicable, then enter a cost of 0.00.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The distance unit of measure for calculating out of route percent or distance and related charges.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The max circuity distance in base units.

columns.name: STOPS_INCLUDED_RATE
columns.description: The Stops Included Rate field indicates the number of free stops included in the rate before stop-off charges apply. The source and destination locations count as stops so, typically, the minimum number of stops included in the rate is 2. Additional charges apply for all stops not included in the rate.

columns.name: FLEX_COMMODITY_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the flex commodity profile.

columns.name: RATE_QUALITY_GID
columns.description: The GID for rate quality.

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: MIN_STOPS
columns.description: Value for the minimum number of stops required for this rate to apply.

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the short line cost.

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST_BASE
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: RATE_ZONE_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate zone profile.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location.

columns.name: ROUTE_CODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the route code.

columns.name: DIM_RATE_FACTOR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the dim rate factor.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
columns.description: Date the rate is effective from.

columns.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
columns.description: Date the rate expires, and should no longer be considered for planning.

columns.name: ALLOW_UNCOSTED_LINE_ITEMS
columns.description: Allow Uncosted Line Items (Y/N) is used when there are one or more ratable objects on the shipment which are not charged or considered for rating when rating a shipment using rate record. Selected: Some basis options within a shipment pass through the rating engine without a charge if other basis options qualify. For example, if a shipment contains four line items, and a rate is found that contains charges for 3 of those items, that rate qualifies for the shipment and the fourth line item ships for free. If there is a conditional charge and a minimum charge, and the conditional charge does not apply, the minimum charge will always be applied. Cleared: This rate only qualifies if all basis options can be charged.

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the shipper minimum value.

columns.name: MULTI_BASE_GROUPS_RULE
columns.description: The multi base group rule determines how the results from multiple rate cost groups are evaluated. Values A/M/X. Options are: Add the Cost, Select the Least Cost, Select the Greatest Cost.  Rate Cost Groups allow you to group rate costs together.  Note: To use Rate Cost Groups, you must have rate groups active within your user preferences.

columns.name: RAIL_INTER_MODAL_PLAN_GID
columns.description: The rail inter-modal plan GID.  i.e. Plan 20 - door-to-door, Plan 25 - ramp-to-ramp, etc.

columns.name: CUSTOMER_RATE_CODE
columns.description: This code signifies what rate is used on a Leg; either 'C' for the Customer's rate, or 'S' for the Shipper's rate.

columns.name: COFC_TOFC
columns.description: The Container-On-Flat-Car/Trailer-On-Flat-Car code used along with the Rail Inter Modal Plan GID  to determine the  rate.

columns.name: EXPIRE_MARK_ID
columns.description: Used to indicate that the rate has been marked for expiration.

columns.name: VIA_SRC_LOC_PROF_GID
columns.description: VIA Locations are used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Locations set up on an itinerary. This field provides the profile GID for the profile/list of source via locations.

columns.name: VIA_DEST_LOC_PROF_GID
columns.description: VIA Locations are used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Locations set up on an itinerary. This field provides the profile GID for the profile/list of destination via locations.

columns.name: VIA_SRC_LOC_GID
columns.description: A VIA Locations is used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Location set up on an itinerary. This field provides the location GID for a single source via location.

columns.name: VIA_DEST_LOC_GID
columns.description: A VIA Locations is used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Location set up on an itinerary. This field provides the location GID for a single destination via location.

columns.name: ROUNDING_TYPE
columns.description: The type of rounding that will occur during rating.  Value are: N=no rounding, I=round to nearest interval, F=floor, and C=ceiling.

columns.name: ROUNDING_INTERVAL
columns.description: Numbers will be rounded (or truncated) to the nearest increment of this value.

columns.name: ROUNDING_FIELDS_LEVEL
columns.description: Determines which kinds of fields will be affected by the rounding settings during costing.  Values are 0-7, where 0=all fields, 1=none, 2=numeric fields only, 3=unit fields (weight, etc.), 4=currency, 5=numeric and unit fields, 6=numeric and currency fields, and 7=unit and currency fields.

columns.name: ROUNDING_APPLICATION
columns.description: Determines when to apply the rounding rules.  Values are A/N/C/O where A=always, N=never, C=conditionals only, and O=cost calculations only.

columns.name: DEFICIT_CALCULATIONS_TYPE
columns.description: When to apply deficit calculations. Values are Y/N/P where Y = Yes, N = No and P = Payant Pour.

columns.name: BUY_SERVPROV_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The ID of the service provider profile to be used when building buy shipments.

columns.name: BUY_RATE_GEO_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The ID of the rate geo profile to be used when building buy shipments.

columns.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_CODE_GID
columns.description: Optional payment method for the rate record

columns.name: IS_MASTER_OVERRIDES_BASE
columns.description: If Y, the BASE rate will not be evaluated and applied for this rate geo.

columns.name: HAZARDOUS_RATE_TYPE
columns.description: Qualifies how the rate should be used for shipments with hazardous materials. The Hazardous Rate Type has three options which can be used to indicate whether the rate can be used for shipments with or without hazardous materials. The options are: Allows Hazardous Materials Hazardous Materials Only Non-Hazardous Materials Only

columns.name: IS_QUOTE
columns.description: Most commonly applicable to spot rates; indicates if this rate is to be found by rate finding logic. During RIQ, if the attached rate offering is a spot rate, the rate geo can only be used if quote is checked.

columns.name: DOMAIN_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Allows you to assign a domain profile ID which defines the compatible or incompatible domains for rate.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVE
columns.description: TRUE FALSE flag indicating if the rate is active or not.

columns.name: RO_TIME_PERIOD_DEF_GID
columns.description: The global ID for the rate offering time period definition which is used to define the time periods for tiered rates.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_SEQ
columns.description: System generated unique identifier for a rate geo. For internal use only.

columns.name: LOGIC_CONFIG_GID
columns.description: Specifies the logic configuration group ID used to look up any logic parameters specified as charge multipliers on costs.  If not null, overrides value specified on the owning rate offering.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_DESC
columns.description: The rate geo description.

columns.name: IS_FOR_BEYOND
columns.description: The From Beyond and For Beyond check boxes allow the existence of two rates with the same geography, such as SPLC to SPLC, to exist with one being allowable for use with Rule 11 and the other one not. Since you cannot have the same GID, this allows you to have the flexibility. The For Beyond check box is for a leg going into a junction as defined on Rule 11 Route Code. The From Beyond check box is for a leg going from a junction. Select both check boxes for a leg going from a junction to a junction.

columns.name: IS_FROM_BEYOND
columns.description: The From Beyond and For Beyond check boxes allow the existence of two rates with the same geography, such as SPLC to SPLC, to exist with one being allowable for use with Rule 11 and the other one not. Since you cannot have the same GID, this allows you to have the flexibility. The For Beyond check box is for a leg going into a junction as defined on Rule 11 Route Code. The From Beyond check box is for a leg going from a junction. Select both check boxes for a leg going from a junction to a junction.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Allows you to constrain the usage of the rate during the planning based the compatibility definition provided by the assigned corporation profile.

columns.name: PARENT_RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: Used for rate maintenance and is provided so you can track the different versions of your rates during the approval process.

columns.name: IS_SOURCING_RATE
columns.description: This column is named as IS_SOURCING_RATE to maintain consistency with RATE_OFFERING table but used to serve the purpose of IS_READ_ONLY in the UI.

columns.name: CALC_CHARGEABLE_WT_VOL_WITH
columns.description: Calculate Chargeable Weight/Volume Using provides you with options for calculating the chargeable weight. If you select this field value as 'Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume', chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume. If you select this field value as 'Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume', chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume.
